text: Heinrich Dreser (1860 - 1924) Heinrich Dreser (1 October 1860 – December 21, 1924 ) was a German chemist responsible for the aspirin and heroin projects at Bayer AG. He was also a key figure in creating the widely used modern drug codeine. Arthur Eichengrün made the claim, yet unproven, that credit for the discovery of aspirin were stolen from him by Dreser. ==External links== * Category:German chemists Category:1860 births Category:1924 deaths Category:Bayer people
